creator: Mike_Buck@mapinfo.com
text:
Our documents have DocumentTypes. It is impossible to convert 
org.w3c.dom.Documents to SVGDocuments in a generic way because this method is 
unsupported in Batik.

Problem exists in v1.1.1 as well.

creator: vincent.hardy@sun.com
text:
Could you provide details as to why you cannot do the convertion to Batik? Even
though Batik does not support DocumentTypes, you should be able to convert to a
Batik SVG DOM Document that does not have a DocumentType.

If you use the Batik org.apache.batik.dom.util.DOMUtilities.deepCloneDocument
with the SVGDOMImplementation, you'll be able to create SVGDocument in a generic
way.

deepCloneDocument does not clone DocumentType nodes as per the importNode's
documentation (see documentation for the Node class).

I am closing this bug report as I do not think this is a bug but rather a
legitimate (according to the DOM level 2 documentation) limitation and there are
ways to convert a Document with DocumentType to an SVGDocument. 

If you feel DocumentType should be implemented in Batik, please enter an RFE for
this new features.
